result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on August 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial on September 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury status hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury Trial on October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No contact with victim(s): Menards in Wausau; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Defendant shall not possess or use any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (2) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:06 pm 
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty John Mathie. 
Address is in Hatley, WI. Deft's phone number: 715-883-4056
Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction. 

PLEA: Not Guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: $700 sig bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): Menards in Wausau. 
- No possession of dangerous weapons. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
